channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Worst of Woke, Courtesy of the Smithsonian
item.description: Good and bad news in the White House’s push for more balance and less bile.

item.title: Seeing France for the First Time
item.description: We never did encounter the legendary rudeness and scorn of Parisians, one of many pleasant surprises and unexpected insights.

item.title: The joke's on Newsom: Court sides with Babylon Bee in striking down anti-deepfake law
item.description: A federal judge tossed a California law intended to prevent fake political ads from influencing elections, finding that the measure violated the First...

item.title: Political Gnosticism Is a Modern Sickness
item.description: The conspiratorial belief that massive hidden systems need to be exposed is gripping left and right.

item.title: Trump taps federal agents to tackle local policing. That's not always helpful, critics say
item.description: It's a scene that has played out on the streets of Washington and Los Angeles since President Donald Trump declared a crime emergency in the nation's ...

item.title: Trump casts doubt on Putin-Zelenskyy sit-down
item.description: President Trump said his hoped-for meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy might not happen.

item.title: Hollywood’s School of Hard Knocks
item.description: Bruce Handy provides a flawed but fun survey of a social phenomenon that American pop culture essentially invented: ‘teenagerhood.’

item.title: Lee Corso Epitomizes The Spectacle Of Modern College Football
item.description: On Saturday, Lee Corso will make his final appearance on College GameDay , the ESPN show he has worked for since its inception in 1987.

item.title: The Risk in Trump’s Ukraine War Exertions
item.description: Are America’s interests truly being served in the president’s diplomatic push?

item.title: Bondi fires DOJ employee for flipping off, cussing at National Guard troops
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi fired a Justice Department employee for "inappropriate conduct" toward National Guard troops who have been deployed to Wash...

item.title: Trump team slashes 500 jobs at Voice of America
item.description: The Trump administration slashed more than 500 jobs at the Voice of America, a potentially fatal blow to the government media outlet repeatedly gutted...

item.title: 20 Years Later, New Orleans Triumphs Over Hurricane Katrina’s Tragedy
item.description: The way the citizens of New Orleans united to restore their home and regain their destiny should serve as an inspiration to us all.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Offends The Bureaucrat Paper Pushers Of Dwindling Influence
item.description: Low utility middlemen in the Trump administration are feeling left out again, and so they’re back to anonymously moaning to the news media. This time ...

item.title: Americans Shouldn’t Have To Pay For Secret Service To Follow Kamala Around On Her Book Tour
item.description: You won’t hear it from the corporate media, but former Vice President Kamala Harris has already had a longer Secret Service detail than other former v...

item.title: Christian Baker Pleads For SCOTUS To End California’s Lawfare Against Her Religious Beliefs
item.description: A Christian baker is asking the U.S. Supreme Court to end California’s attempts to force her to violate her deeply held religious beliefs. In her peti...
